cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles SSE of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest tonight, then turning north-northwest to north and accelerating toward the southwest Louisiana coast; core expected to cross the northern Gulf and move inland over Louisiana then quickly northeastward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron–Creole area of southwest Louisiana (west of Grand Isle, east of High Island, TX)

weather_observation.watch_coast: High Island, TX to Grand Isle, LA (Hurricane Watch); High Island, TX to AL/FL border including Calcasieu Lake (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: No hurricane or tropical-storm warnings currently in effect for the northern Gulf coast (Yucatan Peninsula only)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island, TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border, greatest impacts focused on southwest and south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely Friday afternoon with a 22% chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds and hurricane-force gusts possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible in Calcasieu Lake and adjacent coastal areas, highest if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches Friday–Saturday, producing flash and urban flooding around Lake Charles.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes beginning late Thursday night; dangerous surf and rip currents from large swells ahead of landfall.
